name: South Shore Harbour Resort and Conference Center

reviews.text: Most of the reviews are accurate about this place. It's not very nice and the rooms are poor.
reviews.title: Not much good to say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The A/C was not working when we checked in. They got it fixed. Then we froze the rest of the night.
reviews.title: This is no "RESORT"

likes.disliked: — In need of repair and poor housekeeping service

reviews.title: South Shore Housekeeping Thieves
reviews.text: The bed was terrible. For some reason the mattress was covered in plastic. We had a group and others had the same plastic mattress cover. Talk about uncomfortable. Did not sleep at all.
I would not stay there again unless the place was under new management or remodled.
reviews.title: In bad need of renovations!

reviews.text: I recently returned from a two-night stay at South Shore Harbor Resort in League City, Texas. The rooms were large and the pool was large and nicely landscaped. The property is located on a bay which was nice.
reviews.title: Worst hotel that I've stayed at in years.

reviews.text: I'm here as part of a conference, but I would never return. The hotel is hard to find in an inconvenient location, lacking convenient access to other services. Hard bed + poor pillow options + bad ventilation = lousy night of sleep. No fitness center on site; have to pay and go nearby. Slow internet. Reasonably clean and quiet, but I expect more than that for the price I'm paying.
reviews.title: Not what it claims to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Below average room size and amenities. Not clean! Have to call down to desk for dry towels each day. Only one trash can for the entire suite. Shower tiny and curtain rod hung right in the middle of the space so that your face is in it most of the time. Water facucet needs pliers to turn. Overall - expensive for a below average room!
reviews.title: Below Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always read reviews prior to a new hotel stay so I will be aware of any possible problems, but our stay at SSHR was wonderful! The pool was crowded - duh - it was Labor Day weekend. All the "drinkers" stayed in the swim up bar area where kids should not be allowed anyways....... and its a family hotel, so of course kids will be present in certain areas! The breakfast buffet was awesome and the food was great, especially since it was "free"....not just continental breakfast, they had an omelette bar and all types of choices. The staff was friendly and the decor is a bit different, but our room was very updated and nice. The balconies could use some furnishings, however, we just grabbed chairs from inside and enjoyed our view. Kemah Boardwalk is close, Galveston is close......it has everything. We will stay here again, and for the cost, location, and all that we got for our cost, it was a steal!
reviews.title: This hotel was wonderful and we WILL go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for one night and was so ready to go back home. Looking forward to relaxing by the pool and to my surprise that huge pool was packed full of heavy drinkers and kids. Kids, kids and more kids - there was no chance of actually swimming. Unattended kids were running which is dangerous to them and other in the base case. I love music but it was incredibly loud which contributed to the hard partying atmosphere. The resort itself, while clean was very dated and needs serious updating in the guest rooms. The hallway carpet has a very 1970's look to it in patterned aqua, puke yellow and puke green tones. The hallway walls a similar puke yellow color. When the elevator door opens to that.......yuch. Great balconies and view but no furniture to sit on the balcony. Old furniture, linens, tvs. Rooms very dimly lit. Thermostat was on 60 when we arrived and difficult to get to a normal temp - had to call the front desk and have someone come up. Mattresses covered in plastic (yay great to avoid bedbugs or body fluid soaked mattress) which make for a noisy slumber. Neat, clean but in need of serious updates.
reviews.title: Stay at SSH Resort

reviews.text: I was desperately looking for a get away for the Memorial Day weekend, all the other Resorts were either booked or too pricey, I found SSH. After reading several reviews I was skeptical about my stay at SSH, I took a chance. I must admit I was pleasantly surprised. The reviews I read were all inaccurate and most were nearly two years old. The hotel was clean, the staff were constantly cleaning and wiping. The rooms were huge and well decorated. The staff were very accommodatiing. Late Sunday evening while sitting in the lobby, it was apparent we were cold, a staff member on another task, stopped and ask if we needed a blanket. The breakfast served in the Paradise Reef was excellent and the waitress/staff were constantly tending to our needs. The pool was huge and rival those in Carribean Resorts. At the poolside, this was an entertaining band. I must say a good time was had by all. The location is a plus, it is close to Keman Boardwalk and NASA Space Center. In the SSH proximiny there are several eateries, ranging from fast food to elegant upscale restaurants SSH is a well kept secret. Most of the reviews I read grossly underate this facilitiy.
reviews.title: Truly Underated/Best Kept Secret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a room here because I was attending a 50th b-day party at the hotel. I was worried because of so many negative reviews, but I didn't find anything wrong with the hotel. The front desk looked to be pretty busy when we checked in ( I snuck a peek at a clip board and could see there were several large parties/weddings going on that same night at the hotel) and they were very accomodating when I requested a room change a few minutes later because we wanted a King bed. Our room was nice, clean and spacious. The party we attended was in a nice sized space one floor down from the lobby right next to the pool area and was set up very nice. The finger-food spread was also very nicely displayed and tasty too. There was also a cash bar...but you had to first buy drink tickets and then walk those tickets 2 steps over to the bar to get your drink...I thought that was a little weird and unecessary, but I'm sure they have their reasons for that. Our room came with a complimentary breakfast buffet in the morning which was quite good. I chose to have an omelette at the omelette station...there were tons of igredients to choose from there. I also had some fruit and cheese from the buffet. Everything tasted really good and was set up in a fairly nice setting so I was completely satisfied with that. We did sit at the lobby bar for a bit after we checked in...bartender was very friendly and attentive to our group and the drinks were good! So, I chose this hotel purely for the convenience of not having to drive anywhere after the party I was attending, but I'd happily choose it again if I'm ever in need of a room in the area.
reviews.title: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel.

reviews.text: The rooms are OK but dark - the internet SUCKS and they have closed the only bar / restaurant that had any character.
reviews.title: Zero Zero Zero social

reviews.text: Great place to stay! Super friendly staff! We went for a wedding and all the rooms were easy to book and in a great location. Most rooms were ready for check in well before check in time and everything was great! They gave us ( the newly weds) a complimentary suite which had champagne and choc. covered strawberries waiting for us in the room! great, friendly, family;y oriented place. Wonderful pool and Hot tub!
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: I was at the SSHR for a conference. Here are the cons first:
reviews.title: Not Worth The Money!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to pay $12 for the shuttle to take us from the Airport to the Hotel & $12 again for it to take us from the Hotel to the Airport. The breakfast buffet eggs were disgusting - I don't think they were even real eggs. All the ketchup or hot sauce in the world couldn't make them taste even good enough to gag down and all together it was just overpriced. I tried to eat even a waffle with syrup and it didn't even taste good. Waste of $15. Yes, $15 for a breakfast buffet. The Hotel is NOT within walking distance from ANY restaurant or fast food joint. You have to call a cab (which takes 20 minutes just to pick you up) or get the shuttle to take you (up to a 45 minute wait). Walgreens was the closest thing to walk to, so we went & got protein bars & crackers to snack on. The second day we were there the only thing offered for lunch was a $12 buffet. You couldn't order anything ala carte and there are no other restaurants in the hotel to choose from. We were stuck. I ended up paying $12 for mashed potatoes and rolls (carb city!) That didn't include a drink either! The hotel bar is waaay overpriced for drinks & they close at 10 pm every night. One bartender, no waitresses or waiters. The hotel 'club' is upscale, pricey & also closes at 10 pm, so if you are having a good time, you should just pay for a cab to take you to kemah (about 10 mins away) and stay all night. I had to call maintenance the night we got in due to insufficient plumbing - I didn't even go #2 & it was starting to overflow. the maintenance guy was quick, but said there was a 'trick' to flushing and taught me how to do it. seriously. the 3 hour dinner cruise booked through the hotel was awful - buffet style food & they made us line up single file to get our food. 150 people being served on a hour cruise buffet style is not ok. There were people still eating when the cruise had already docked. internet access is $9.95 per 24-hour period and didn't work half the time we were there and the staff didn't care & we were not offered refunds. Overall, the location of this hotel is just not good if you are traveling without your own or a rental car. Do not depend on the shuttle to take you anywhere & cabs cost a fortune. At least one of the ladies in our group had her stuff 'rifled' through between the time she left to go get a 'to go' breakfast and the time she returned. none of the maid staff speaks english. The 'fitness center' was about 1/4 mile away & you had to pay $5 to use it every day. To me, the hotel is guilty of false advertising when it comes to their fitness center - it's not even at the hotel & having to pay for something they claim is part of the hotel is ridiculous.
reviews.title: Better than a hotel on the highway

reviews.text: Our High School Class held a reunion here on Sept. 4 & 5, 2009. I was on the planning committee and dealt with the Sales and Catering Departments from the beginning, some months ahead of the event. The cooperation and attention that we recieved was outstanding. The event itself was cared for down to the last detail. I must mention the Sales representative, Sharon Whitten, the Catering representative, Noella Lambert and the Banquet Captain, Manuel Mendez for their wonderful help.
reviews.title: A great place for a meeting.

reviews.text: The entire experience was wonderful. The rooms were very nice and recently renovated, the facilities were beautiful, the banquet was superb and the staff was polite, caring and efficient. I highly recommend this hotel for a similar function.
reviews.title: Good Breakfast but, that's about it

reviews.text: Robert Fay
reviews.title: Overall a great experience
Use the term "resort" loosely.
reviews.text: My family stayed on a weekend at the end of July. We got a great rate ($109 nt) since my son was playing in a baseball tournament nearby. We went to the pool which had a nice layout however there was a band playing that drew the Jimmy Buffett "Parrot Head" crowd. They were loud and pretty inebriated. Not that big of deal except we had our kids with us. Empty drink glasses/cans were left littered all around the pool area and no one seemed to be coming around to pick them up. The rate we got included a breakfast buffet for the 4 of us. The breakfast was really good...omelet station, french toast, eggs, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit, grits, etc... One thing that really creeped me out the morning we were checking out... My son found a MasterCard receipt in his bed between the blanket and comforter. The receipt was some man's dated the week b/4 we were there and was a charge of $525.00. The name of the place that charged the guy was XTC South. EW! I took the receipt to the manager at the front desk and she said she would take it up with housekeeping. She did give my a $50 credit to my bill. I don't think we would stay here again ....too many other choices in the area.

Our family came from all over the US to attend a wedding. The staff went out of their way to attend to our needs. The rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. My only complaint was that they do nickle and dime with the per diem rates for the internet and refrigerators and they could use some additional lighting in the rooms. The pool area was clean and fun.
reviews.title: beautiful view not the best service
